docs.abstract: In prepared testimony ahead of congressional hearings on Wednesday, Facebook and Twitter displayed a conciliatory approach over issues such as disinformation and manipulation.
docs.snippet: In prepared testimony ahead of congressional hearings on Wednesday, Facebook and Twitter displayed a conciliatory approach over issues such as disinformation and manipulation.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For months, Facebook, Twitter and Google have grappled with criticism over the misuse of their services by foreign operatives and the disproportionate influence their platforms have over people’s thinking.

headline.main: Facebook and Twitter Have a Message for Lawmakers: We’re Trying
headline.print_headline: Facebook And Twitter To Congress: We’re Trying

byline.original: By Cecilia Kang and Sheera Frenkel

docs.abstract: Patients near death are increasingly getting high levels of physical, occupational and speech therapy, raising questions about the true purpose of such services.
docs.snippet: Patients near death are increasingly getting high levels of physical, occupational and speech therapy, raising questions about the true purpose of such services.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nursing home residents on the verge of death are increasingly receiving intense levels of rehabilitation therapy in their final weeks and days, raising questions about whether such services are helpful or simply a lucrative source of revenue.

headline.main: Costly Rehab for the Dying Is on the Rise at Nursing Homes, a Study Says
headline.print_headline: Pricey Rehab for Nursing Homes’ Dying Rises

docs.abstract: The rate of those 65 and older filing for bankruptcy is three times what it was in 1991, a new study finds, as more enter their later years in a precarious position.
docs.snippet: The rate of those 65 and older filing for bankruptcy is three times what it was in 1991, a new study finds, as more enter their later years in a precarious position.
docs.lead_paragraph: For a rapidly growing share of older Americans, traditional ideas about life in retirement are being upended by a dismal reality: bankruptcy.

headline.main: ‘Too Little Too Late’: Bankruptcy Booms Among Older Americans
headline.print_headline: Bankruptcy Booms Among Older Americans as Safety Net Frays

docs.abstract: A small but growing number of people are cobbling together what they need to get a substantial down payment by asking an outside investor to put down part of the money.
docs.snippet: A small but growing number of people are cobbling together what they need to get a substantial down payment by asking an outside investor to put down part of the money.
docs.lead_paragraph: For aspiring homeowners, coming up with a healthy down payment has long been the biggest obstacle to owning a home.

headline.main: Getting Down Payment Help Now. Sharing Home’s Gain (or Loss) Later.
headline.print_headline: New Twist On Paying For a House: An Investor

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

docs.abstract: The average debt load is flattening out, a new analysis of federal loan data shows, but college isn’t getting cheaper. Many students are hitting their borrowing cap, and parents are filling the gap.
docs.snippet: The average debt load is flattening out, a new analysis of federal loan data shows, but college isn’t getting cheaper. Many students are hitting their borrowing cap, and parents are filling the gap.
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s a sign of the times: A new game show, “Paid Off,” debuted on Tuesday offering winners not dream vacations or new cars, but a pile of cash to help lessen the crushing weight of their student debt.

headline.main: The New Toll of American Student Debt in 3 Charts
headline.print_headline: College Debt Isn’t Shrinking. It’s Likely Shifting to Parents.

byline.original: By Tara Siegel Bernard and Karl Russell

docs.abstract: Technology has changed the way that movies are made, but not how our chief film critic likes to review them — and he has a low-tech writing method.
docs.snippet: Technology has changed the way that movies are made, but not how our chief film critic likes to review them — and he has a low-tech writing method.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? A. O. Scott, a chief film critic of The Times, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: The One Thing A.O. Scott Doesn’t Use to Review Movies (No Spoilers!)
headline.print_headline: Watching New Movies the Old-Fashioned Way

docs.abstract: Mr. Dorsey testified before the House on the moderation of online content. Earlier in the day, he appeared at a Senate hearing with Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook.
docs.snippet: Mr. Dorsey testified before the House on the moderation of online content. Earlier in the day, he appeared at a Senate hearing with Sheryl Sandberg of Facebook.
docs.lead_paragraph: • Jack Dorsey, Twitter’s chief executive, testified on Wednesday before the House Energy and Commerce Committee about the moderation of online content. The hearing took a more political tone than a Senate hearing earlier in the day, but he avoided taking sides.

headline.main: Twitter’s Dorsey Avoids Taking Sides in Partisan House Hearing

byline.original: By Cecilia Kang, Sheera Frenkel, Kate Conger, Matthew Rosenberg and Nicholas Fandos

docs.abstract: The Italian men’s luxury group is looking for growth beyond traditional suiting. The deal for Thom Browne offers it a chance to capitalize on trends in fashion.
docs.snippet: The Italian men’s luxury group is looking for growth beyond traditional suiting. The deal for Thom Browne offers it a chance to capitalize on trends in fashion.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Ermenegildo Zegna, the Italian fashion group known for its classic men’s suits, said on Tuesday it would buy a majority stake in Thom Browne, an insurgent American label, underscoring the family firm’s ambitions to reach new markets and court a younger set of customers.

headline.main: Ermenegildo Zegna to Buy Thom Browne in a Bid for Younger Customers
headline.print_headline: Zegna Group, Courting Younger Fashionistas, Acquires Upstart Label

byline.original: By Elizabeth Paton and Vanessa Friedman

docs.abstract: Mainland China sales — especially online — are set to account for much of the growth in the global luxury market this year, according to a new report.
docs.snippet: Mainland China sales — especially online — are set to account for much of the growth in the global luxury market this year, according to a new report.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — After several years of slumber, China’s luxury market is finally returning to growth. You would not know that, though, from peering into its — mostly empty — high-end stores.

headline.main: Luxury Sales Are Rebounding in China. Just Not in Stores.
headline.print_headline: Chinese Are Again Buying High-End Goods, but They’re Not Flying Off the Shelves

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA

byline.original: By Elizabeth Paton and Sui-Lee Wee

docs.abstract: Consideration of the rule comes after a report found significant pay disparities between ethnic minorities and their white counterparts.
docs.snippet: Consideration of the rule comes after a report found significant pay disparities between ethnic minorities and their white counterparts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Companies in Britain would have to report pay disparities among ethnic groups in their work force under a rule being considered by Prime Minister Theresa May’s government.

headline.main: Britain May Require Companies to Report Race Pay Gap
headline.print_headline: U.K. May Make Employers Report Racial Salary Gaps
